thread.title: High school athletes of the week for Oct. 1-8
thread.title_full: High school athletes of the week for Oct. 1-8

author: azcentral.com
title: High school athletes of the week for Oct. 1-8
text:
High Achiever of the Week
Samantha Berg
School: Mesa Red Mountain
Class: Senior
Sport: Badminton
Has a 4.7 GPA ... Enrolled in honors classes ... Plays varsity-level on the badminton ... Also No. 2 on the tennis team last season ... Named as a National Merit Finalist ... She looks forward to competing in the city and state tournaments ... Coach Maggie Borze said Berg is a natural leader, and younger teammates look to her for guidance ... Wants to apply early for liberal arts at Haverford College ... Berg said badminton helped her build confidence because she used to be shy ... Also mentioned that her favorite memory was from last season with her doubles partner during a state match, playing Desert Vista ... "Sam is my go-to girl when I need help," coach Maggie Borze said. "I am new to the sport, so when there are certain techniques that I am uncertain of, I can go to Sam and she can then inform me on how to present the strategy."
AZCENTRAL
High school athletes of the week for Sept. 24-Oct. 1
Wahid "Ali" Hameed, from Gilbert High School, is azcentral sports' Male Athlete of the Week. (Photo: Provided to azcentral sports)
Male Athlete of the Week
Wahid "Ali" Hameed
School: Gilbert
Class: Senior
Sport: Golf
Has a 2.9 GPA ... No. 1 player on the golf team ... Won the Dobson Invitational Tournament, Sept. 30-Oct. 1, shooting an 11-under-par for the two-day tournament ... Has a 10-match/tournament winning streak going into the last three matches and tournaments of the year ... His scoring average for the season is better than 1-under-par ... Part of the Junior Golf Association of Arizona ... Played golf, the sport he got involved in because of his dad, since he was 10 years old ... Volunteers with Tico, a Pakistani information culture association ... Qualified for Junior World in summer 2015 ... Considering ASU or Southern Utah University, so far ... Wants to study business ... Coach Joseph Fraher said other golfers know how good he is and say that they want to be like Ali ... "He doesn't get himself too high or too low," Fraher said. "He just plays the game."
AZCENTRAL
Nominate the best high school football Fan Experience
Olivia Fairchild, from Desert Vista High School, is azcentral sports' Female Athlete of the Week. (Photo: Provided to azcentral sports)
Female Athlete of the Week
Olivia Fairchild
School: Phoenix Desert Vista
Class: Senior
Sport: Volleyball
Has a 4.28 GPA ... Plays opposite in Desert Vista's volleyball team ... Six-rotation player that takes over the front and back row ... Serving rate is 95.5 percent (22 aces) and hitting .333 (243 kills of 538 swings) ... Passed 171 balls and credited with 48 blocks and 153 digs ... Throws javelin in track and field ... Member of Rho Kappa Social Studies Honor Society ... Volunteers to coach volleyball at the Club One U clinic at Club One Volleyball ... Said she loved winning state in the 2014-15 season because it was a great experience with all her teammates on the court ... Committed to Fordham University to study business ... She hopes to go to law school, too ... "She will run through a wall for you," coach Molly West said. "She is fearless."
Learn more about azcentral sports' Arizona Sports Awards at hsawards.azcentral.com .
Compiled by Arizona Sports Awards producer Samantha Incorvaia .
